metadata.synopsis: The main dialog for the Tadpole Checkpoint event. Triggered either by simply entering Haven, or being caught sneaking inside.Jaheira tests us to see if we carry a tadpole - and must be convinced to let us enter once she discovers we do. Mol and Marcus vouching for the player is aliased across both states of the player being entangled and free from vines.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Various approaches - entering haven openly, sneaking in, arriving with our without Harper escort. All are routed to the barricade checkpoint where this dialogue takes place.To test in editor use the follow recon command to setup:oe havchec

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *The guard insists that you meet with their leader - a Harper by the name of Jaheira.*
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) We follow the Harper past other Harpers that eye us with suspicion. Soon they spot the person they're looking for and calls out to her: |InternalNodeContext: Player was sneaking inside but was discovered by someone. Jaheira was called in crime dialog.

86.speaker: Jaheira
86.context: InternalNodeContext: Dialogue was interrupted after someone vouched for the player, but before the question of how they got access was fully resolved.

87.speaker: Jaheira
87.context: InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed, but player counterspelled his summon.

188.speaker: Jaheira
188.text: Be on the alert, Harpers! We haven't seen the last of Marcus yet.
188.context: NodeContext: a martial order to her squad, who are shaken by witnessing a hideous transformation

54.speaker: Jaheira
54.text: As for you - you exposed a True Soul in our midst. You're no puppet of the Absolute, are you?
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to player, speaking more quietlyNodeContext: Looks at us anew. Still suspicious, but intrigued too.

0.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The player takes Orpheus from their pocket and presents it to Jaheira who looks on intrigued. There’s a crackle of energy and she reacts to something in her pocket. She takes out the jar again and we see the tadpole flail wildly inside - then the jar explodes and the tadpole drops to the ground dead. There are gasps from the crowd, and several of the Harpers move in to strike us down. |

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: What in the hells is that thing?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Tell Jaheira everything you know about the artefact.

136.speaker: Jaheira
136.text: Congratulations. You've earned yourself the benefit of the doubt.

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: Hear me, Harpers! All clear, at ease!

175.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Those Harpers who still had their weapons drawn stow them way. The tension among them dissipates now that Jaheira has cleared us. |

245.speaker: Jaheira
245.text: I'll not pretend to understand what that artefact is, but I'm old and wise enough to recognise a sliver of hope when it crawls out of the dark.

242.speaker: Jaheira
242.text: Tell me - why have you come here?

259.speaker: Player
259.text: To destroy the Absolute in its lair: Moonrise Towers.

257.speaker: Jaheira
257.text: Then you've found an ally in me, for that is precisely why I am here.

267.speaker: Player
267.text: To pursue vengeance against the cult of the Absolute.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I just want a cure for the parasite in my head. Moonrise Towers is my only lead.

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: Then our interests align. We must all cure ourselves - of the entire cult of the Absolute.

239.speaker: Jaheira
239.text: There's food in the inn over there. Beds too if you require rest. Aloe oil in the cupboard in case the vines gave you a rash.

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: Settle in, then come join me for a drink. You may just be the godsend we've been praying for.

48.speaker: Jaheira
48.text: You're just in time for happy hour.

82.speaker: Jaheira
82.text: Not anymore. Not with so much at stake.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: This land is afflicted - rotten. I am here to restore nature's will.

250.speaker: Jaheira
250.text: I'll not pretend to understand why you, the enigma that you are, suddenly crossed our path, but I'm old and wise enough to recognise a sliver of hope when it crawls out of the dark.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: So far it's been a life-saver. Here's hoping you agree.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Your guess is as good as mine.

137.speaker: Jaheira
137.text: Strangest magic I've seen since roaming the ruins of Myth Drannor, but I can't argue with the results.

133.speaker: Jaheira
133.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player's 'I work in mysterious ways.'  losing patience

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You'll just have to take my word for it.

224.speaker: Jaheira
224.text: You sound so confident for someone who's so wrong.
224.context: NodeContext: tension - losing patience, with an edge.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: I know it's hard to trust anyone right now, but believe me: I am not an Absolute cultist.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I know it's hard to trust anyone right now, but believe me: I am not an Absolute cultist.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I routed your spy, didn't I?

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I routed your spy, didn't I?

169.speaker: Player
169.text: The Weave itself burns through my veins - perhaps the tadpole is afraid.

46.speaker: Jaheira
46.text: I've met no sorcerer that powerful - and I've met many. Now, speak plain - how do you have control?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I suspect this icosahedral artefact is involved. (Show Jaheira.)

129.speaker: Jaheira
129.text: Bah! Vile things that befit a vile traitor.
129.context: InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed and summoned claws, and the NPCs are reacting to this,

220.context: InternalNodeContext: | (CINE) We arrive at a place bathed in moonlight: a safe haven amid the shadows. Armed Harpers draw their weapons as we approach, and call out to us: |

198.speaker: Harper Elifer
198.text: You there! Step forward and keep your hands off your weapons!

67.speaker: Harper Karrow, Harper Lassandra, Harper Meygan
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking up from beside the player and stepping forward, speaking to Elifer

80.speaker: Harper Branthos, Harper Elindale, Harper Manus, Harper Skywin
80.text: Easy! They helped us out in the shadows.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking up from beside the player and stepping forward, speaking to Elifer

151.speaker: Player
151.text: I am Lae'zel. It is your pleasure to meet me.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Someone lost in the dark, drawn to the light here.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Who am I? Who in the hells are you?

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I've come from Moonrise Towers - I just freed some prisoners there.

75.speaker: Harper Elifer
75.context: NodeContext: High tension - player has just approached the checkpoint and given a reason why they've come.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: The name's [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Jack of all trades, master of plenty. Charmed, I'm sure.

17.speaker: Harper Elifer
17.text: We'll see how charmed you are in a minute.

193.speaker: Harper Elifer
193.text: Just keep your hands where I can see them and follow me.

91.speaker: Harper Elifer
91.context: CinematicNodeContext:  (CINE) The Harper beckons us to follow. |NodeContext: To player, The Harper beckons us to follow

215.speaker: Harper Elifer
215.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) We follow the Harper past other Harpers that eye us with suspicion. Soon they spot the person they're looking for and calls out to her: |

213.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira approaches. Haper Elifer is about to speak, but a stern glance from Jaheira shuts them up and makes them cast her eyes to the ground. Jaheira then directs her stern glance at us. Without a word she raises her right hand claw-like to chest height. Magic ripples and entangling vines start to sprout from the ground, trapping the party in place. Onlooking Harpers draw their swords. |

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Holy shit. It's really you. The Jaheira.

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: You have me at a disadvantage. Let me correct that.
19.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Just this once, I wish people would simply say hello.

249.speaker: Jaheira
249.context: NodeContext: Unamused, not actually welcoming, but matter of fact. Menacing.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: Please - ma'am - I'm from Baldur's Gate. Like you. I'm on your side.

172.speaker: Jaheira
172.text: I'll be the judge of that.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Easy. Give me a chance to earn your trust.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Please - I've already saved some people imprisoned by Absolute cultists. I'm here to help.

126.speaker: Jaheira
126.text: An act of kindness, or a clever decoy. Luckily, I know how to find out which.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I saved your soldiers and this is the thanks I get?

244.speaker: Jaheira
244.text: Kindness is too often a decoy.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Could you at least explain to me why you're doing this?

232.speaker: Jaheira
232.context: NodeContext: She says this knowingly - she suspects us to be part of the Absolute so she can say this with a lot of emphasis and double meaning.

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: Nervous? I've an inkling you've reason to be.

146.speaker: Jaheira
146.text: This is why we're here, you see.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) With her free left hand, Jaheira fishes a jar out of her back pocket and hold it up for us to see. It contains a tadpole. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. She’s about to make a demonstration.

190.speaker: Jaheira
190.text: It is a curious creature that hides all manner of secrets. But if there's one thing that we know -
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira approaches with the jar outstretched - in it floats the tadpole, motionless and seemingly dead. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. She’s about to make a demonstration.

201.speaker: Jaheira
201.text: - it's that it knows its own kind.
201.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) As the jar nears our face, the tadpole suddenly LASHES TO LIFE, straining towards us through the glass. | 

| (CINE) Her suspicions now confirmed, Jaheira stows away the jar. The onlooking Harpers eye us with a mixture of fear and hatred. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. The demonstration is done and she’s proved her point: we’re the enemy because we have a tadpole in our heads.

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.text: You should never have come here, True Soul.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira raises her free left hand, signalling the surrounding Harpers, who ready their weapons  to attack |NodeContext: Grave. She’s passing a death sentence on us.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I am not... a True Soul...

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Look to the Harpers you saved.

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.text: Stand down, or we'll put you down.
101.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player rages against the vines to snap them and succeeds. In response Jaheira reels back but then returns to a spell-casting pose, ready to kill the player - she still beleives them to be a True Soul. 
[greg reshoot] have her start casting Flaming Sphere between first and second line; more threatening please

253.speaker: Jaheira
253.text: I'm not interested in the Absolute's manipulations.

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: Harpers - cut this True Soul down.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira holds her hand aloft, preparing to give the order to attack the playerNodeContext: Projected to her soldiers.

263.speaker: Jaheira
263.text: It'll hurt less if you hold still.
263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player struggles against the vines trying to escape, but fails. Jaheira turns her hand, claw-like, again, in a further attempt to kill the player.

230.speaker: Jaheira
230.text: I mourn for whoever you were before the Absolute infected you.
230.context: NodeContext: Right Hand still claw-like trying to kill player.

15.speaker: Mol
15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The focus remains on us and Jaheira. The shout comes from off-camera. |

| (CINE) Jaheira glances over as a small figure pushes through the Harpers. It's Mol. |

89.speaker: Mol
89.text: What are you doing? They're the ones that saved us!

100.speaker: Jaheira
100.text: They're the one who protected the Emerald Grove?

205.speaker: Mol
205.text: Yup. Didn't leave a goblin standing. Not so bad to hang around with either.

231.speaker: Mol
231.text: Saved two of my friends - one from a harpy, and one from a mad druid with a snake. Didn't make a fuss of our thieving, either.

3.speaker: Mol
3.text: Saved two of my friends - one from a harpy, and one from a mad druid with a snake.

223.speaker: Mol
223.text: I'd pretty much trust them with my life.

258.speaker: Jaheira
258.text: A True Soul with a mind of their own... How is that possible?

76.speaker: Mol
76.text: Plucked one of my friends out of a harpy's talons. Knows when to be discreet, too.

154.speaker: Mol
154.text: Saved one of my friends from a druid with a snake. Knows when to be discreet, too.

110.speaker: Mol
110.text: Plucked my friend right out of a harpy's talons.
110.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

209.speaker: Mol
209.text: Saved us from a mad druid and her snakes. A real class act.
209.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

180.speaker: Mol
180.text: Even caught us thieving and didn't make a thing of it.
180.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

37.speaker: Fist Marcus
37.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The focus remains on us and Jaheira. The shout comes from off-camera. |

| (CINE) Jaheira glances over as a Flaming Fist soldier pushes through the Harpers. It's Marcus. |

177.speaker: Fist Marcus
177.text: Hold on, Jaheira. I think I know this one.
177.context: NodeContext: Marcus is a spy, butting in to save us.

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *His eyes meet yours. There's no recognition there - just a sick intensity as his voice reverberates in your mind.*

44.speaker: Fist Marcus
44.text: If you want to survive this, then trust me - one True Soul to another.
44.context: NodeContext: Urging us to play along

186.speaker: Fist Marcus
186.text: They're infected, aye - but they're not with the cultists. Helped me fight them off a while back, in fact.
186.context: NodeContext: Speaking warmly of us, a lie to convince Jaheira to trust us.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.context: NodeContext: to player, surprised but wary that you've been given a reason to trust them

144.context: CinematicNodeContext: She lowers her hand before speaking, and the vines on the player fall away.NodeContext: you have this person surrounded with your troops - 'Harpers' - and you're asking them to explain themselves quickly

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: If the True Soul wants to help, so be it. We're in no state to refuse.

217.speaker: Astarion
217.text: Don't do anything stupid - just say he's right and get us out of this!

165.speaker: Gale
165.text: Might as well take part in this Absolute charade if that buys us both time and our lives.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: Play along with the Fist. We can deal with him later.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: That tadpoled Fist thinks we're his allies. No need to correct him just yet, if he can help us.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: A True Soul! Play along for the minute - we can kick his arse afterward.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: He's right. I was enslaved by the cult and served them once, but I'm free of them now.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: He's right. Mind flayers infected me, but they don't control me.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: You haven't tested him, have you? He's infected too.

106.speaker: Fist Marcus
106.context: NodeContext: Utterly shocked - he thinks we're on the same side and we've just outed him as a spy, getting us both in trouble

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: Marcus? He's been with us from the beginning. Since...
26.context: NodeContext: About to dismiss our claim, then thinks about it

176.speaker: Jaheira
176.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at MarcusNodeContext: Pointed question

116.speaker: Fist Marcus
116.text: Jaheira, come now. This one's parasite has dug a little too deep, eh?

204.speaker: Jaheira
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (Cine) Jaheira takes out the jar and holds it in Marcus’ direction. The tadpole flails as madly as it did when she did the same to us. The crowd gasps. |

265.speaker: Fist Marcus
265.context: NodeContext: calm, despite being suddenly exposed and surrounded by enemies on all sides

95.speaker: Fist Marcus
95.text: The Absolute has given me many gifts already. She'll give me so much more when all of you are dead.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Large wings unfurl from Marcus' back, and the crowd back away in shock.|NodeContext: Uncannily and eerily calm despite being exposed as an enemy and surrounded on all sides

58.speaker: Fist Marcus
58.text: You, most of all, will suffer for this blasphemy. Your life is mine, but in death you will belong to the General.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: mind-meld, looking player right in the eye, Marcus forms a triangular symbol with his hands.

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: Go quietly - it'll be easier for all of us.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: Offer a prayer to your god for salvation.

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: A pathetic deception - I know who you really worship, True Soul.
21.context: NodeContext: angry, ready to kill the player

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Beseech your patron to help you.

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *Your request falls deep into the nameless reaches of your patron's home plane. It seems to be met with deafening silence.*

105.speaker: Player
105.text: A preposterous experiment - the tadpole could be reacting to anything. Let me GO!

211.speaker: Jaheira
211.text: Wizards... Always talking, never knowing when to be quiet.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Channel your rage. Pull apart these puny vines.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: Force your own magic through vines, loosening them.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Force your own magic through the vines, weakening them.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Jaheira, is it? I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], and I assure you none of this is necessary.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Jaheira, is it? Like I told your guard, I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], and I assure you none of this is necessary.

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

227.speaker: Player
227.text: I have been named Faithwarden. I command you to release me.

184.speaker: Jaheira
184.text: Oh, but you ward something far more sinister than faith alone, don't you?

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Call me Lae'zel, if you must call me at all. Now explain yourself.

225.speaker: Jaheira
225.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I'm Shadowheart. I'd offer to shake your hand, but I'm in a spot of difficulty.

255.speaker: Jaheira
255.text: Rather more than a spot, actually.
255.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

229.speaker: Player
229.text: The name's Astarion. And I rather dislike vines in uninvited places.

181.speaker: Jaheira
181.text: You won't have to like them very long.
181.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm Gale, and I find myself only moderately pleased to meet you.

49.speaker: Jaheira
49.text: Ever so sorry to hear that.
49.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I am Wyll, the Blade of Frontiers. Perhaps you've heard of me?

228.speaker: Jaheira
228.text: I heard the Blade of Frontiers was a hero, not a hellspawn.

33.speaker: Jaheira
33.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

166.speaker: Player
166.text: You have to the count of five to let me go.

260.speaker: Jaheira
260.text: A count to five is all I need.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Usually I'm not the one in the snare - mind releasing me?

99.speaker: Player
99.text: If I have to rip these vines apart, I will. And then I'll do the same to you.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You're the Jaheira? I have heard of you, Friend of the Forest.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Something like that. Did you hear that I saved your soldiers?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Care to explain why a legendary druid has one of her own wrapped in vines?

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I heard you were strong - smart. Seems I heard wrong.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: How uncouth. Legends led me to expect better of the noble Jaheira.

194.speaker: Jaheira
194.text: It seems tales of my clemency have been greatly exaggerated.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: At least give me a chance to earn your trust.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: So it would seem. Did you hear that I saved your soldiers?

115.speaker: Player
115.text: If you let me go, I'll happily amend the tales. Add a 'hates strangers' footnote.

238.speaker: Jaheira
238.text: You have not experienced my hatred, stranger. Not yet, at least.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: If this is supposed to scare me, it won't work - monks are not so easily cowed.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: A level head. Let us see if you will get to keep it.
55.context: NodeContext: Amused, approving of our courage in pushing back on her - but not to be swayed

83.speaker: Player
83.text: At ease, Jaheira - I am no threat. I am bound by oath not to harm the innocent.

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: Hah! Well I am certainly no innocent, paladin - so I'll bind you with vines a moment longer, if you do not mind.
18.context: NodeContext: Snort of amusement at player's high-handed attempt tell reassure her they don't 'harm the innocent'.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I am magic incarnate - these vines will not hold me.

183.speaker: Jaheira
183.context: NodeContext: Wry, amused at us calling ourselves 'magic incarnate'. Deadpan and dry more than mocking - she's moving on to her actual business - testing us for a tadpole

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Fascinating - both your command of magic and its technical implementation are impeccable.

156.speaker: Jaheira
156.text: A good start - but you've told me something I already know. Tell me something I don't.
156.context: NodeContext: Dryly amused at our attempts to compliment her, but not to be swayed - moving immediately onto the business of checking us for tadpoles

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I fight with the strength of ten warriors - do not trifle with me.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am a druid - a servant of nature's will.

192.speaker: Harper Elifer
192.text: A fellow druid? She will want to meet you.
192.context: NodeContext: surprise, but still a hint of suspicion ('she' is Jaheira)

214.speaker: Player
214.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am a monk, here on a pilgrimage.

189.speaker: Harper Elifer
189.text: You picked a strange place to meditate, monk.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am but a humble cleric.

118.speaker: Harper Elifer
118.text: A cleric? You'll find no quarter here - for you, or the one you serve.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to protect the innocent and fight for justice - I mean no harm.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to protect nature, and her creatures, from evil. I mean you no harm.

81.speaker: Harper Elifer
81.text: A paladin? She will want to meet you.
81.context: NodeContext: surprise, but still a hint of suspicion ('she' is Jaheira)

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to deliver justice at any cost. Unless you harm another, you are safe from me.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I walk my own path, and mean you no harm - for now.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - a master of magic, and the secrets it holds.

104.speaker: Harper Elifer
104.text: No doubt a wizard has opinions on this darkness - she will want to meet you.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - a sorcerer, at your service.

179.speaker: Harper Elifer
179.text: Hm. Convenient that a sorcerer would emerge from the darkness, of all places.

236.speaker: Jaheira
236.text: There you are! I thought those vile claws dragged you into a terrible grave.
236.context:
InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed and summoned claws, and the NPCs are reacting to this,
The player was outside of dialogue range for a minute, so they're also reacting to that.
